file_content.text: This is Captain Quellon of the Starrunner. SOS, I repeat, SOS. We are caught in Hoth's gravitational pull, and falling fast.
Strange events date back two weeks. Yavin Four artifacts believed to be the source. Something has taken control of the ship.
To whomever finds this message: Burn this vessel. Don't look inside, don't touch it. Burn it.
Lieutenant Drellik really is something else. Could find a wampa hair in a snowdrift, I bet.
Is there anything else recorded on the beacon? Coordinates perhaps? A hint of where the ship may have fallen.
Is that the end?
Not as I can tell. Might take a good going-over in the lab. But what are those tracks?
It still doesn't tell me where the ship is.
But where is the ship?
No, but we have a bearing from the beacon launch. And those tracks... somebody beat us to this thing.
Do you expect me to get excited about a distress beacon?
I'm hardly thrilled.
Well, it confirms the existence of your ghost, for one. And these tracks might mean something.
Lieutenant, sir, we've found the beacon but no ship. There're some light tracks, though; appear to be a few days old.
Have Shalora zoom in, Sorrel. I've been studying alien tracks since I was old enough to know a Twi'lek from a tuk'ata.
Erm, no offense.
Ortolan. I'd know them if they were six days old and covered in jam. Those are Ortolan tracks.
You think the Ortolans know something about this?
How does that help?
I'll be sure to look for you next time my ship's galley is invaded by a pack of Ortolans.
Covered in jam? Good to know.
Ha! That's a good one. I'll have to remember that next time the Imperial Reclamation Service trackers' committee meets.
What's an Ortolan?
Ortolan?
A cold-weather type of alien who've made their home on Hoth. Usually peaceful--until recently.
It looks like those Ortolans dug something up--possibly a clue to the ship's location. Sorrel, where's the nearest Ortolan camp?
It's a ways beyond the next outpost. But the tracks look headed in the right direction.
Might be time to put on your best diplomatic face, my lord. Ortolans don't like outsiders much, but it looks like they're the key to finding our ghost.
I will be utterly charming.
No problem.
A little lightning will break them. It always does.
No need for diplomacy.
Sounds a little gruesome, but who am I to question a master's methods?
This chase better give results, or I'll have your skin for a cloak.
I'm getting tired of this.
Never so much as a pottery shard has escaped me, my lord. We are on the right track.
I'll have Sorrel bring the beacon to the base. Between it and the Ortolans, we're bound to have a breakthrough.
We'll be there when you're through dealing with the Ortolans.
